newsitem.title: USA: Compaq ups Raptor stake to 6.6 pct.
newsitem.headline: Compaq ups Raptor stake to 6.6 pct.

text.p: Raptor Systems Inc said Monday Compaq Computer Corp had boosted its stake in Raptor and now holds 6.6 percent of its common shares, up from the 4.2 percent acquired prior to Raptor's intial public offering.
Raptor said Compaq, through a wholly-owned subsidiary, had exercised warrants to buy 363,636 shares of Raptor's common stock at a price of $11.00 per share.
Compaq said it has now invested about $10 million in Raptor following Compaq's original January 16, 1996 investment in the company and Monday's warrant exercise.
On April 15, 1996, Compaq and Raptor executed a definitive Network Security Partnership Agreement.

Under terms of this marketing and development agreement, Compaq was granted various manufacturing rights for Raptor's Eagle NT firewall security product line on any Compaq server machine. They also agreed to work together on future products.
